VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Guidelines When Creating Coupons for Your Storefront

When you create a coupon, decide on the type and amount of discount you want to offer. Specify what conditions, if any, a buyer must meet before the coupon is valid.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
Minimum Required Coupon Metadata

For any coupon to appear on your storefront, complete the following fields on a CC Coupon record:

Specify a Coupon Name and Coupon Code.
Set the coupon's Start Date and End Date to a range that includes the current date.
Select a Rule Type, enter a Discount Type, and enter a Discount Amount.
Use the Storefront field to assign the coupon to at least one storefront.
Specify a Max Use and Total Used.
Select Enabled.
Coupon Name and Coupon Code
Coupon Name
Displays on the Shopping Cart page after the code is applied.
Coupon Code
The code that you want a buyer to enter on the Shopping Cart page.
TIP For a consistent user experience, specify the same value for both Coupon Name and Coupon Code.
Rule Types

Use the Rule Type picklist to select which cost the coupon is discounting.

CartTotal
The discount applies to the total price of the shopping cart.
General
The discount applies to a certain product or a product with a specific spec value.
Shipping
The discount applies to the cost of shipping the order.
NOTE To support shipping coupons, first set up shipping methods and costs using CC Shipping Rates records. A shipping discount can apply only to shipping methods that have enabled the Default field on the CC Shipping Rate record.
Discount Types and Amounts

Use the Discount Type and Discount Amount field to specify the size of the coupon's discount.

DISCOUNT TYPE VALUE	DISCOUNT AMOUNT BEHAVIOR	EXAMPLE
Absolute	The value entered for Discount Amount is a fixed amount using the coupon's currency.	If the coupon's currency is USD, enter 10 for a discount of $10.00.
Percentage	Because the Discount Amount field uses the Currency Field Type, the value entered displays in currency format, with two digits of precision. B2B Commerce converts this value to a percentage when the coupon is applied on the Shopping Cart page.	Enter 10 for a discount of 10%.
Price	The value entered for Discount Amount overrides the buyer's entitled price from a price list and sets a new price using the coupon's currency.	If the coupon's currency is USD, enter 10 to set a price of $10.00.
Currency ISO Code

By default, a coupon amount uses the storefront's default currency. If your storefront supports multiple currencies, you can restrict a coupon so that it applies only to a particular currency.

In the Currency ISO Code field, enter the ISO 4217 code for a particular currency, such as USD or JPY.

When you specify a currency, B2B Commerce compares the coupon's currency with the shopping cart's currency. If the currencies don't match, the Shopping Cart page shows an error.

TIP We recommend that you use this field only when Discount Type is Absolute or Price.
Max Use and Total Used

In the Max Use field, specify a limit for the number of times that a coupon can be used considering all storefront users. For example, if you enter 300, the coupon can be applied up to 300 times across all carts and all users on your storefront.

When you create a coupon, leave Total Used at 0. B2B Commerce automatically updates this value when buyers place orders with this coupon applied.

Minimum Quantity

To specify that a coupon is valid only when a specific number of products exist in the cart, enter a value in the Minimum Quantity field.

When this field is blank, the minimum quantity requirement doesn't apply.

Coupon Notes

To add internal-only documentation for a coupon, add text to the Coupon Notes field. This field isn't user-facing on the storefront.

Cart Total Amount

To specify that a coupon is valid only when the shopping cart totals a specific price, enter that price in the Cart Total Amount field.

When this field is blank, the minimum price requirement doesn't apply.

Coupon Target and Coupon Source

You can specify a product or a product with a specific spec value that the coupon applies to. You can also specify whether the coupon depends on another product being purchased.

Coupon Target
The product or product with a specific spec value that is eligible for the discount.
Coupon Source
The product or product with a specific spec value that a buyer must also purchase before the discount is valid for the target.

For discounting a product or a product with a specific spec value without requiring other purchases, use only the Coupon Target section. For examples, see:

Offer a Discount on a Product

For a coupon that requires the buyer to purchase other products, use both the Coupon Target and Coupon Source section. For examples, see:

Offer a Buy-One, Get-One Discount on Products
Offer a Discount on a Product When Purchasing Any Product with a Specific Spec Value
